 # Objective <a name="objective"></a>
 
I recently discovered in my journey as a budding Data Scientist that Python will be a crucial tool on a day-to-day basis. While several wonderful FREE online sources exist to teach yoou the nuances of a new language, I personally believe tat you'll learn better while doing. Learning anything new can be exhausting, but it need not be boring. 

I've challenged myself to code projects that I find particularly interesting or want simulated! In this process, I would like for this repository to be a space for multiple beginners (or experts) like me, to contribute and help it grow. You would also learn version control this way! BONUS!

Credit goes to Leah Nguyen, whose mini-python-project idea has been a great source of inspiration in my learning journey. [Check her profile out here!](https://github.com/ndleah) 

-----------

2Ô∏è‚É£
# Pre-Requisites <a name="pre-requisite"></a>

Please make sure your workstation is installed with Python 3, preferably.  

<details> 
  <summary>
    For Windows Users
  </summary>
  
  See how you can install python 
  [here](https://phoenixnap.com/kb/how-to-install-python-3-windows) 
  
  
  </details>
  
  <details> 
  <summary>
    For MAC OS Users
  </summary>
  
  I've coded these programs with the help of Anaconda & Jupyter Notebook. 
  
  You can download latest version of Python [here](https://www.python.org/downloads/macos/) 
  
  [Here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iNjXL9KbN4w&t=240s) is a wonderful tutorial I found on how to get started with Anaconda & Jupyter.
  
  
  </details>

5Ô∏è‚É£
# Projects <a name="projects"></a>

Here's the list of all the completed projects. 

|SNo|Project Name|Description|Created By|
|---|---|---|---|
|1| [7Up7Down](https://github.com/iaks23/iLearnPython/tree/main/7Up7Down)| A simple simulation of a popular party game played with dice, 7 Up 7 Down.|[A Sarathy](https://github.com/iaks23)|
|2| [DotsnDash](https://github.com/iaks23/iLearnPython/tree/main/DotsnDash)| A piece of code that converts a user given word/phrase/sentence into Morse code, the encoded result will be printed out in dots and dashes.|[A Sarathy](https://github.com/iaks23)|
|3| [Rock, Paper, Scissors](https://github.com/iaks23/iLearnPython/tree/main/RPS)| A simulated version of the infamous ROCK, PAPER, SCISSORS played against the computer in a best of 1 or 3 or 5 match. May the odds be ever in your favor.| [A Sarathy](https://github.com/iaks23)|
